Comments: Domestic and General is a corporation that shows complete awareness about the issue of modern slavery and has enclosed a copy of they're modern slavery agreement on the company website that has been approved by the board of directors. Metric: Walk Free Foundation+MSA supply chain disclosure
Comments: The company does not mention the specifics of their suppliers due to competitive reasons, however, they do guarantee that all their suppliers across the word are treated in a way that incorporates the values of the modern slavery act and complies with the legislation. The company also has a list of conditions that must be fulfilled by suppliers before entering into a contract Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 15:10:06 UTC

Value: Use of risk management tool or software

Metric: Business & Human Rights Resource Centre+MSA Statement Approval
Comments: The statement has been approved by the board, and signed by the director as well, and the above was done on 14/07/2020. Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 14:49:27 UTC

There are no specific organizational policies regarding the modern slavery act that have been published by the company, apart from a document containing it's compliance with the legislation of the the act Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 15:14:38 UTC

Metric: Walk Free Foundation+MSA Impact on Company Behaviour
Comments: The company disclosed the the fact that all operations in the business took place in accordance with the terms of the law in 2016, however from then up until recent times there has been a change in approach towards modern slavery on the company's part in the sense that they have incorporated new policies that serve as corrective measures for any breach in the terms of the act and have spread more awareness on this matter in their organization over the past few years by providing to employees and supply workers training on the modern slavery act. Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 23:01:03 UTC

Value: Audits of suppliers (self- reporting), Audits of suppliers (independent), On-site visits (self- reporting), On-site visits (independent)
Comments: The company does have a set of procurement principles that it requires it's suppliers to comply with before and after entering a contract. Suppliers are expected to maintain effective policies and procedures to manage day-to-day business activities. Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 15:38:02 UTC

Value: Whistleblower protection (direct employees), Whistleblower protection (supply chain workers), In Development (direct employees), In Development (supply chain workers)
Comments: The company does a have a specific whistleblower policy in place for all employees and supply chain workers, alongside it's procurement and business ethics policies. Employees in the organization are required to report any concerns regarding the breach of law and are also given training to understand and enforce the practices of the law in the day to day business. Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 16:13:22 UTC

Metric: Walk Free Foundation+MSA Business Performance Indicators
Comments: The company in the first place has not disclosed the specifics of the suppliers and their geographical location, however, it has in place certain policies to ensure compliance with the law of modern slavery, furthermore from the annual report of the company, intention to expand is noticeable however the ethical implications of their expansion plans have not been disclosed. Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 22:51:11 UTC

Value: Worker remediation, Corrective action plan, Senior management, Cancel contracts
Comments: There have been no incidents published by the company that breach the specifics of the modern slavery act, however it does have corrective measures and other specific policies put in place in case of any deviation the terms of the act. Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 15:49:25 UTC

A detailed business model has been enclosed in the annual report of the company and, contains graphic representations of company growth in recent years. Pranav Chandnani[https://wikirate.org/Pranav_Chandnani].....2020-10-19 15:00:35 UTC

Metric: Business & Human Rights Resource Centre+Modern Slavery Statement
Comments: Published in accordance with the Modern Slavery Act 2015. It sets out the steps taken by Kurt Geiger Ltd ("Kurt Geiger”) to prevent modern slavery and human trafficking in its business and supply chains during the 13 month financial period ending 28 January 2017. joseph francis[https://wikirate.org/joseph_francis].....2017-10-18 12:08:37 UTC

Metric: Walk Free Foundation+MSA Identification of risks
Comments: Exposure to modern slavery risk is considered to be greatest in our product supply chain.
